text: Orange colour. Aroma is lots of fresh fruit, like walking through an orchard in-season. Taste is peach and green apples with a hint of vanilla. Moderately tart.
This is an a-typical geuze for me. Less horse blanket, more funky fruitness and a tad sweetness in aroma and taste. Very nice.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl chez Charlie et Renaud
Couleur ambrée/cuivrée, petite mousse et grosse effervescence
Nez sur le brett
Acide en bouche fruit confit bel équilibre avec une pointe amère et très sèche un délice.
Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Pas mon style donc pas très agréable pour moi. Acidité classique, rien de plus.

Toer de Gueze 2017. Bottle at Geuzestekerij De Cam. Cloudy orange with white head. Very stinky aroma, sourish with notes of rubber, wood, yeasts and some fruitiness. Sour flavor with notes of lemon, wood, "green", farmhouse, unripe fruits. Very dry, soft carbonation, medium-bodied.
Bottle at Geuzestekerij De Cam during Toer de Gueze 2017. Cloudy yellow. Aroma of barnyard, herbs, wood barrel. Light sweetness, sour, lots of wood, lemon, green apples. Medium-bodied, smooth. Great.

Bottle shared by a friend. Pours clear gold to amber with a medium off-white head. Aroma of malt, big funk, vinegar and citrus. Malt and funk flavor with citrus accents before a tart and bitter finish.
Bottle, 750 ml in Craft Room. shared with Marko, Trolleo, veceo. Pours hazy yellow, no head. Sour, barnyard, citrus, funk, dry finish. Soft carbonation. Medium bodied.

Liquide doré. Au nez, boisé doux et murmure de fromage. Pommes et balles de foin. En bouche, aigreur boisée non-agressive et poussière de béton. Finale astringente sur des notes de liège. Corps sans réelle vie. Intéressante proposition. Merci à tom10101 pour ce beau verre.

6% op het etiket. Troebel blond/bleek oranje bier met witte schuimkraag. Geur: zacht zuur, citrus, guimauve en ietwat stalgeur. Smaak: zacht zuur, fris, wat citrus en wat exotisch fruit. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Aangenaam zachte verfrissende geuze!
Taster. Cloudy yellow, White head. Funky, citrus, barnyard, apple, nice geuze aroma. Tart, very balanced. Dry.
Bottle at Lambicus. Orange colour with white head. Funk and citric aroma. Funk, citric, acidic taste. Medium body.
Bottle - White grape, funk and lemon rind. Cloudy gold with a frothy white head. Bright and funky with a nice crazy clean finish.

Pour at the brewery. Pours out a hazy golden topped with a small head. Nose is funky barnyard horse blanket wood light citrus notes. Taste is more of the nice funky tartness barrel notes and a nice light fruit note.

Bottle. Hazy copper in colour. Very earthy yeasty barnyard funk aroma and taste. Earth, leather, barnyard. Funky & musty. Tart, sour, very dry taste throughout. Citrus-fruity (grapefruit & lemon) and green apples. Long very dry finish. More subtle than some gueuze. Liked this a lot. Nice gueuze! (2008)
First whiff a lot of barn, later more leather and hay funk, sweet white greengages and dry white raisins, citrus, medium pediococcus sourness, nicely balanced
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Semi-hazy orange pour with a thin white head. Notes of peaches, white grapes, barnyard funk, lemons, overripe apples and pears, baking soda and salt. Medium body and medium to high carbonation.A nicely balanced geuze, not too sour, not too funky.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle; likely 2015. 
Aroma is nice with a moderate oak notes and quite a bit of barnyard, earthy funk. Some light citrus notes. Hints of stone fruit. 
Pours a hazy, pale copper-orange with a large, frothy, white head that recedes quickly to a thin film that lingers in clumps in some spots. 
Flavor is fairly acidic and slightly harsh. Light sweetness. Moderate oak notes with hints of citrus and stone fruit. Light earthy, barnyard funk with a light herbal character. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with high carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, an alright geuze and better than other bottles of this beer that I have opened, but its still a bit off. Carbonation is definitely too high, but also the flavor and aroma is not as deep and complex as it could be.

75 cl. 2015, 6% ABV, aperta il 13 novembre 2016.
Oro antico, velata dai lieviti , schiuma bianca non molto persistente e irregolare.
Aroma di legno umido, polvere, note di cuoio, uva bianca e mela verde.
Al palato legnosa, polvere e cuoio uva bianca e ribes acerbo, finale amaricante con frumento e buccia di mela che equilibra la bevuta in modo eccellente.
Man mano che si scalda fanno capolino note erbacee.
Ben carbonata, corpo medio, texture oleosa, finale secco.

Bottled 750ml. -at the MBR Sour Beer tasting. Slightly hazy golden coloured, small to medium sized off-white head, sour acidic nose. Citrus, wood, notes of grapes and ripe green apple (slightly perfumed) with pleasant sourness in the finish. Good one.

Pours a clear to hazy gold from the bottle depending on when you pour and how much yeast is mixed around, bubbly white head that dissipates quickly to leave moderate lace. Aroma of funky brettanomyces notes, hints of wood, subtle acidity, light fruitiness. Taste follows, so much going on its hard to pick out all the flavors. Awesome, especially when the blender pours it for you.
Really nice aroma of funky peaches and lemons, with excellent translation of these into flavors that are not overly acidic or too heavily carbonated. A cut above Cantillon Classic, in my opinion.

Botella del @Señor Lúpulo. Despacho de cervezas, Gijón 17/09/2016
Color amarillo,sabor acido, buen cuerpo, buena.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2017 At the MBR Sour Beer tasting. Thanks to whoever brought it! Murky golden body. Citric, funky, fresh aroma with a light malty touch. Bitterish citric, appley not too sour clasically funky taste, light sweetish touch. Interesting, balanced Oude Geuze that did not disappoint!

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2016 75cl, jan 2009 bottling. Opens with a big plop, big gusher! First glass is mostly foam. On to the second... Pours a hazy orange with bubbly head. A: mellow and fruity sourness, nice tart maltiness, lime, melon. T: follows aroma, very manageable tartness in beginning. Malts and fruity tones in development, mostly melon, lime, light sour apple note. Nice bitter finish with orange and melon tones. Very accessible, fruity, yet delicious. High carbonation makes it a heavy drink though.
Bardzo klasyczny aromat skóry, ziemi, siana, agrestu, winogron i cytryny. Smak średnio kwaśny, wytrawny i z lekką goryczką ziołową.

De Cam oude Geuze 13 Vintage consumed on 160708

Pours a clear amber-orange color with a bubbly, medium head, which turns out to be unusual stable.

Smells of a profound funkiness, entangled into dried apple peel and dusty, old oak. Has a mineralic stony quality with wet mushrooms and a flowery grassiness to it. White bread and sour lemon pulp compliment both to the pungent funk in this, establishing an awesome, aromaful nose, which is hard to compare to any of the other Lambic.

Has a lively but fitting carbonation and an utmost refreshing light body, revealing tons of flavor nuances. This creates an ever developing taste, which focusses throughout on its taste defining sourness.

Tastes of moldy earth, old apple peel, wet stones and a juicy lemony whiff. The lemon turns more flavorful after this initial stage, opening up the palate to a well dosed sourness, defining the flavors without getting close to numbing the tongue. Apple gets a tad sweeter during the finish with an aqueous softness, wrapped up by crisp lemon peel. 

Drinks very nice, full of fruit supported funk with a bright, soft finish, soothing the sourness without loosing any character. Moldy, matured white wine characteristics get combined with crisp lemon and create an inciting potential.

375ml Bottle, 2009 vintage. A hot day like today calls for a refreshing lambic so I cracked my 2009 Oude Geuze from De Cam.
6.5% and a crystal clear deep gold with an incredible nose of oak, lemon, ripe bananas(?), and a peppery/woodsy funk.
Medium bodied with a sharp carbonation and a dry finish.
The taste is tart, acidic, tannic oak, white pepper and very dry. Man this hits the spot. If youre a fan of lemonade on a hot day then grab a geuze to enjoy.
On draft at the Sovereign in Georgetown. Pours a clear light copper with an off white head. Woody, musty aroma. Flavors of bandaids, dank straw and tart apple. Yum.

Koelship. Nice sound when opening. Happy new year. Short lasting 2 finger foam. Golden slight haze. Stall wooden plum notes. Fresh sour taste lovely blended with the dry finish. Good oak body. Very drinkable. Complex too. Champagne go home ;). ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 2009 vintage. The cork pops right out of this one, but no gusher is in sight. Instead, a gentle smoke arises from the bottleneck, promising a very high carbonation level contained within the liquid therein. Pours a slightly hazy light golden body with a large creamy white head. Aroma is smooth funky brett notes, hay, lemon peel, citric notes, straw and hints of minerals, red fruits and grape peel. Taste is lemon juice, stable notes, lots of funky brett tones, hay, citrus peel and hints of grape peel, cellar must, straw and vinous fruity tones. Light, dry body, high to fizzy carbonation. A real funkfest and a lovely dry, slightly fruity geuze with lots of character. Very nice.

Bottle, 1998 Vintage. Hazy amber with very small white head. Deep aroma with layers of petroleum, oak, apple zest. Taste follows the same with some dusty rubbery notes that actually fits perfectly here. Light funk, mellow citrus and apple notes. Extremely nicely balanced flavors. Quite mild overall with just hints of dust, stable and funk.
Bottle. Aroma is super funky. Big barnyard and cotton funk, some vinegar and oak. Tastes like barnyard and oak big time. Moderately sour, very dry, great funky barnyard.

Backlog 2015-06-05
Like all the rest a 2009 bottle. ;)
Small gusher and quite heavy carbonated. Nice taste to it and quite tart! Nice!
Hazy amber liquid with small white head. Aroma of cider vinegar, cellar. Taste same, light sweet, heavy sour. Medium body, light feel, soft carbonisation, long finish.
Bottle. Pours slightly hazy orange with small white head. Aroma: Fruity, sourish, vinegar, raw apples. Taste: medium + sour, viger, acid, raw apples, slight sulphur, hay. Well balanced.Nice one.
One of my favorite Geuze , awesome taste , well balance , fantastic aroma, recommended for lambic lovers

0,75 bottle. Pale transparent yellow colour. High white head. Hay, horseblanket, wood in the aroma. Vinegar, white wine, grass at first. Sourness in the middle. Hints of oak. Nice tingle on the tongue. Wini-like aftertaste. Very well balanced, light bodied, refreshing geuze. It is suprisingly smooth, but still so tasty.

Bottle shared at home. Clear dark golden with fizzy white head that leaves some small bubbles and islands. Hay, lemon, funk, light earthy and dried leaves, a bit doughy in the background. Unfortunately theres also a bit of acetone/wood glue in the finish. Over medium sour and very light bitter. Medium bodied with fizzy carbonation. Nice fruity and quite acidic geuze, too bad the horrible glue notes are ruining the finish.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden with big lasting white head. Aroma is moldy, cheesy and funky. Hay, lime, grapes, hops, peach, orange, clove, melon, apples. Dry notes. Taste is sour with citrusy tang, orange, lemonade. Does however disappear really quick with light watery body. High carbonation. Fairly dry finish with some hay.
0,75 bottle at Cirkus bar, Stavanger. A great beer. Fantastic taste and a unforgetable aftertaste. I just love this beer. Must drink again!
Bottle shared at the Geuzestekerij De Cam. A superbe missing link between a great prosecco and a great beer.

December 26, 2015. Bottle, bottled January 2009 (according to the label...),
Hazy yellow with a large frothy and quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is funky, barnyard, lemon juice, some green apples, light minerals and grass, hints of leather. Taste is sour fruity, funky barnyard notes. Light dry finish, sour lemon and apple notes, some funk and barnyard and minerals. Light bodied, soft small bubble carbonation. 
Very good, the citrusy and funky character reminds me of stuff from 3 Fonteinen.

Superbe robe blonde aux reflets dorés, mousse abondante. Nez tout en élégance, typé sur un fond de lambic et de bois, note acidulée et citronnée. Bouche à la très belle attaque raffraîchissante, très grande buvabilité et longue finale acidulée. Une très belle gueuze élégante et équilibrée.

750ml bottle shared with Alberto (ippopotamo36), Ryan and Justin Hawke. Pours pale golden, unclear with a regular white foam. Aroma of hay, barnyard, cellar dust, citric notes. Flavour has a good sourness, persistent, still citris notes, tart, light astringency. Medium body, medium carbonation. A great gueuze!
Hazy orange color with no head. Funky-fresh, wood aroma. Citrusy, some lacto taste. Low but still present carbonation. Fantastic stuff. Already this old at this not so old age.
Bottle at Zwanze Day Zurich, 2009 vintage. Feels very old for a 2009 vintage opened in 2015. Some pure lemon, but nicely balanced and smooth. Impressive!
Straw color. Big white head. Lots of lacing. Huge bouquet of funk and citrus. Some malty notes mixed in. Taste is tart fruit and funk.

Bottle 0.75l at The 8th Belgrade tasting Session Two at Alberto place in Pozarevac.18.07.2015.Grazie Mortlach for this bottle I hope we will meet each other soon.Vintage 2009 bottle.Pour it little bit hazy orange color with small white head.Aroma dusty.Taste of some sweet fruits, grapes, not so sour, nice balanced.Good thru times.Iliked it.

Pours hazy orange with a very low white head. Aromas of funk, citrus, gooseberry, farmhouse. Taste is very tart with mainly citrus and gooseberry. Mouthfeel is very dry and tart with medium carbonation.

At the 8th tasting (round 2), held in Vranovo and Pozarevac. Bottle (2009 vintage) courtesy of mortlach. Grazie, ciao Luca. Pours a bright and hazy golden-orange color, huge white tick head. Nose: lemon skin, funky, Mouth: lemony, citric, fresh, thirsty quenching, pungent but nice.

2009 Vintage. Drank in a blind gueuze line up. Nose is slightly volatile with hints of rubber and burnt hair mixed with stonefruit, musty basement funk and wet wood. Palate follows with a nice mellow complexity and less volatile strangeness but the finish is abrupt and a bit thin throughout. Not bad but didnt stand out as one of the better ones from the line up.

From a 2009 bottle. Pours almost clear gold with a fizzy white head. Smells like pilsner malts, wheat, vanilla, oak, and citrus. Tastes like dry malt, light acidity, light fruit, and faint oak. Light/medium body and carbonation.

2009 bottle. Pours mostly clear gold with rising fizzy white head. Aroma is pislner malts, wheat, vanilla, oak, and citrus. Flavor is dry malt base, soft acidity, light fruit esters, and faint oak. Light/medium body.

From old notes. From 375ml bottle at Copenhagen Olfestival 2012. This was the first sour beer that I tasted. Light hazy golden color with small white head. Aroma is sour citrusy and wood. Acidic taste, tart citrus and wood again. Light oily body, soft carbonation.

Sample, green bottle, de Philippe Boutin (merci!), at Stephen Morris, savoured on December 12 2014; eye: peach, hazy, no effervescence, no head no lacing; nose: old, wild yeasts, lactic, acidity, sourness; mouth: old, wild yeasts, lactic, sourness, sour finale with lactic presence, medium body, good carbonation, slick texture; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, bouteille verte, embouteillée le 1.2006, de Philippe Boutin (merci!), chez Stephen Morris, savourée le 12 décembre 2014; il : pêche, voilée, pas deffervescence, pas de mousse, pas de dentelle; nez : vieux, levures sauvages, lactique, acidité, aigreur; bouche : vieux, levures sauvages, lactique, acidité, aigreur, finale aigre avec présence lactique, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation, texture coulante; en résumé : bien

Assaggio da 100ml allo Zythos Beer Festival 2015:

Amo le geuze ben bilanciate e questa è perfetta. Colore giallo scarico, aromi di coperta di cavallo, vino bianco e aceto. Equilibrio perfetto per tutta la bevuta.Corpo leggero, secchezza al palato ed una abbondante carbonazione la rendono piacevolmente beverina. Sicuramente una delle mie preferite nel panorama acido belga.
In bottiglia ZBF 15. aroma di mela verde, lime, scorzi di limone, al palato sapori di cantina, rustico, mela verde e lime.
Hazy orange colour with no head. Yeast and sourness in the aroma. Flavour has some fruity notes and a sharp tang.

Bottle at Zythos Beer Festival 2015, Leuven - BE. Color: pours hazy dark amber beer with no carbonation and no foam. Smell: very fruity taste and floral. Good sour balance on nose. Small wine notes. Taste: very good balance of sweet sour taste and caramel malt. Very nice sour attack and good sweet finish. One of the best Oude Geuze that I tested. Aftertaste: dry sour finish. Small sweet presence.

10cl sample at Zythos Bierfestival, Leuven. Hazy yellow, white foamy head. Very tard and fruity white grapes and green apples, light barnyard funk and a nice creamy malty palate. High carbonation, medium body.
Golden hazy with small white head. Sour aroma. Sour taste with some sweetness at beginning and dry bitterness at the end, the latter remains in the aftertaste.
Strong, but strongly sour aroma. Palete rather boring. Sour also in taste. Not my style.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2016 Bottle 75cl bought at Dranken Marlou in Zonhoven.
This one pours nice hazy golden with a decent white fluffy head.
Nose: very malty with that typical sewer feeling, even a little bit metallic, slightly sourness. Taste: strong carbonation. The cork popped out when taking of the capsule. Slightly sour taste, pretty malty with wooden notes and al slightly metallic feeling. The aftertaste is strong dry. Not so much a sewer and barnyard feeling. I suspect this is a very young Geuze. The label is not reliable. Karel uses mostly the same labels, so the date may not be correct. Ive tasted other Geuzes from De Cam and they tasted really different. (very strong sourness), this one didnt please me much. But I gave it a great rating because the past tastings.

Pale orange with a white head. Aroma is green pepper, mild funk, kalamata olive. Light bodied, very little sourness on the palate, more like a mild tartness. Lot of vegetal / green pepper on the taste.

Bottle in the hotel. Pours cloudy yellow with a medium, fizzy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is black walnut, sour and tart bacteria, lemon notes, stale earthy hops and soft pears. Flavor is tart, sour, and acidic lemon and white grapes, light malt and stale hops with lemon notes, black walnut and a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

Shared 0,75 l bottle at Hall Toll, Stavanger. Misty golden body with a white small head. Grapefruit and other pleasant sour aromas on the nose. Light to medium bodied. Refreshing citric sourness and a rewarding cereal finish. Easy to drink.

2006 labeled bottle opened up at the 2014 Ottawa End of Year Gathering.Hazy amber with no head. Light acidity, epson salts, hay, funk, lemon zest, and some wet blanket. Mild carbonation and full but refreshing body, long finish that dries out and leaves a slightly tart, more funky and somewhat light lemon cleanse.
Bottle shared by Mike. Nose is crazy complex. Fruity. Almost vanilla? Taste is holy puckering. Second taste does much better. Slightly cheesy. Very nice.

Bottle, 2009, thanks bul11zeye! Homer tasting. Pours clear golden apple. Minimal lacing and head. Aroma is Brett, funky, dusty, oak, apple, gym socks. Flavor is dry, light plus tart, medium funk. Medium light body.

Didnt get nearly enough of this on the share but what I got was awesome. Pours hazy dirty yellow with a moderate foamy white head. Aroma is slight tart, yeast and funk. Taste is just a smooth tartness that doesnt really make you pucker, just makes you want more. Nice farmy funk and complexity from the acidity and light malt bill.

Bottle: Poured a hazy dirty yellow color lambic with a nice off-white foamy head. Aroma of funky ester with some green apple tart notes is pretty enjoyable. Taste is a balanced mix between funky ester with some barnyard notes and green apple tartness. Body is full enough for style with good carbonation for an 8 year old bottle. Good balanced between complex flavours and good drinkability with limited acidity level which I appreciated.

2006 vintage. Man this was nice. Pours slightly cloudy an no head or lacing. Nose is tart with some pledge. Flavours ar elemon, barnyard, yeas some cheerios. Tastes medium/heavy sour, light sweet. Mout is acidic, lots of lingering sour. Really well balanced, what a great beer.

Bottle 75cl, shared with my gf.
Hazy orange golden with a white fading head, lot of sparkling.
Aroma has acid, barnyard, dusty, grains, fruity.
Dusty taste as well, citric, fruits and a bit wood.
Dry finish.

375 ml corked and caged bottle split two ways. Slightly hazy golden pour with lots of sediment and some small lacings on top. Lots of funk, leather, barnyard and citrus. Does have some off flavours though, moldy wood and cork notes.

Bottle at DHVL, 2005 vintage. Clear blond with small white head. Aroma is Woody, funk leather and oxydation notes. Taste is very acidic, brett and citric tartness. Palate is light and dry. Not in the best shape but still good.
Big lively co2. overflowed, broght our sour pear and lemon. Exactly what youd expect in this type of brew. Great product.

37,5 cl bottles in 2009. This 5 year old unpasteurised gueuze explodes on opening. You have to be quick with all the wild yeast pressure. Pours a hazy murky amber with lively and fizzy foamhead. Vanishes real quick. Aroma is hops, hay, malt, apple. Taste is hops, acidic, needs more body.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2015 Old geuze blended from Boon, Lindemans and Girardin lambics. Orange blonde colour with fierce, champenoise sparkling and dense, frothy head, very powerful and attacking aroma, funky, complex as any old geuze, with lots of citric acidity, barnyard, old cheese, almost agressive estery fruitiness and woody sherry notes. Taste equally complex and fruity, strikingly acid (a true neige geuze) - in fact, I found this to be among the most sour of all geuzes I tasted so far. But it has all the finesse and freshness of any geuze and I am glad this blender has taken up the tough job of making traditional lambic beers anew back in the nineties.

Bottle 37.5cl @ DeCam Volkscafé. 
Dorée orangée col blanc. Arôme est type gueuze note grains léger boisé avec une petite note fruitée. Palais sec et terreux. Note cuire avec ce rappel typique de gueuze sur pointe fruitée citronnée en gardant ce côté cave. Pétillante moyenne et rustique, fleuri finissant sur un léger aigrelet qui reste bien balancé. Le profil reste juste un cran faiblard, cela relevé par le manque de pétillance. Sinon, une très bonne gueuze.

Bottled On January 2009. Ponad 5,5 letni prastary Lambick. Geuze pelna para, zaskakuje juz na samym poczatku, mocnym i hucznym wystrzalem korka i podczas nalewania tworzy sie niesamowicie wielka piana, grubo pecherzykowa, taka jak w szampanie ale jest dlugotrwala naprawde. Chyba pierwszy raz taka spotkalem w piwie Geuze. Kolor zloto metny lekko jasno pomaranczowy. Sprawia wrazenie lekkiego ale po chwili alfa kwasy daja znac o sobie w przelyku, jest wytrawne niczym luksusowe wino bez najmniejszej ilosci cukru, perfekcyjne odfermentowane. Mozna sie zakochac w tym kwaskowatym posmaku.
Shared a 2009 bottle with a friend. Poured a cloudy golden colour with a good white head. Vinegar, tart, oak, citrus, herbal notes, murky old hop bitterness. Acid notes. Not the best geuze ive had

Bottled. Pours hazy, golden with a small, white head. Aroma of green grapes, yeast, brett, barnyard and spicy notes. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Light bodied, watery texture and soft carb. A nice and crisp Geuze.

Bottle in kulminator 2009 really awesome beer, very balanced. 
Nice beer!
(Backlog) at spontaneous fermentation. Golden pour with white head. Floral, light spice, tart aromas. Flavors are tart fruit, leather and funky tones.
Bottle 09 - pours a hazy yellow w/ orange hue, lots of carbonation. The nose is tart, lemony, grassy, and sour. A tart, sour taste with lemon zest and a little peppery. Damn good!!!

Bottle poured a golden in color with a huge half glass of white foamy head. Aroma has oak, mild acidity, yeasty funk, and lemon. Mouth feel is medium light and there is high carbonation. Flavor has a fair bit of yeasty goodness, lemon, lighter acidity, and some barnyard.
Very good gueuze lambic from them, full of complexity and very sour, but balanced and well made!

Bottle 0.75l at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Botteldatum: 15-03-2003. Colour is slightly cloudy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, dryness and sourness. Pretty pleasant and nice drinkability.

12cl draught tasting sampler at Volkscafé De Cam, pre NvdGD 2014. Pours a deep gold, with a slight prickle as vestigal foam activity. Contained effervescence and hence aromatics: vanilla wood cask, late cheese notes. A present aged hop tingle in the rhubarb compote and intense lemon zest carries a vinous sweetness into a cultured, astringent finish. Love how De Cam is carving out a fresh and subtle niche in moderate fruit-acid balance and retuning age-old musty harmonies.

Geuze amb aroma a palla i fusta, en boca és bastant àcida però facil de beure.
Geuze con aroma a paja y a madera, en boca es bastante ácida pero fácil de beber.

The barnyard funky horse blanket aromas are there, but they are not as prnounced and upfront like other geuzes ive had. There are many as upfront aromas light lemon zest, wet hay, and musty hops, also. The finish is quite tart, but again, i expected more, but its still very enjoyable. Im really digging the incredible balance between the sourness and other flavours.

Bottle shared at the January 2014 tasting in Santa Cruz. Orange gold color. Apple skin and champagne aroma. Flavor has apples, lemons, some wheaty malt, and a heavy brett finish with some bitterness. A different gueuze for sure.

Bottle. 6.0%. Best before 01.29. Pours a hazy golden/light amber with an off-white head. Decent lacing. Tart, fruity aroma with a note of horse blanket. Remote wooden overtone. Flavour is sour and fruity, with a horse blanket note, and a metallic overtone as it warms. Sour, dry and bitter finish, lingering light note of apricot. 14.03.14.

375 ml corked bottle from January 2009 (6% ABV). A hazy/cloudy dark blonde beer, with a huge, fizzy, mostly diminishing white head. The aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), moderately to heavily yeasty (barnyard, dust/attic, cheese), with notes of citrus and apple. The flavor is moderately sweet, heavily acidic. Medium body, watery/velvety texture, lively carbonation, dry and pretty long finish with light bitterness. Another excellent beer from De Cam.

Bottle as shown thanks to Rainer. Pours a cloudy orange with small off white head that diminshes to nothing. The aroma is a strong funk and oak. Thin mouthfeel with strong funk and fruit with light sourness in finish. Very good.
Bottle. Pours gold with a bubbly white head. Tart, dusty funk, medium acidity, some rhubarb sweetness, and a long dirty finish. Lovely.

Bottled( bottled 15/3/2003): Cloudy, deep golden with an orangey sheen, loose, but quite stable white foam, apples and citrus fruits in the mouldy and slightly bretty nose, some unusual herbal aromas detectable as well; solid dry sour flavour with a bitter touch, light to medium bodied; cidery and mouldy in the sour and astonishingly bitter finish. 375 ml bottle

It was tough to choose a starting point with so many fine lambics on display. Eventually I went with a brewery that I wanted to know more about - De Cam. This was a great choice as it turned out to be nearly as exceptional as the Cantillon. If someone offered this to me it would be hard to turn down.

Aroma / Appearance - The bronze carbonated body was accompanied by a stiff white head. Vinegar, blue cheese, and sweaty gym socks that have fermented in a locker are the things you imagine from a world class gueuze. The dryness reminds me of a top notch brut.

Flavor / Palate - The tartness in the acetic profile stings the tongue. Like drinking the rinse water from sweaty gym clothes it has a nice funk. The lemony polish of the transition carries into a blue cheese finish. Beers like this are the reason that I wanted to come to Belgium in the first place. No wonder they are nearly impossible to find in the US.

375ml bottle, shared by tmoney99 / alexsdad06. Hazy yellow / orange peach color. Minimal white head. Loose dots of lace. Great big oaky citrusy nose, lightly funky. Medium body-plus. Interesting texture - kind of chalky and gummy.. More dry up front, lightly sticky in the finish. Kind of chewy overall. Good bigger tart taste, light sweet. Enjoyable geuze.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2016 2013-06-28: 7+4+8+3+16. Bottle, botteldatum: Jan. 2009. The cork came off with a loud pop by itself when I loosened the thing that keeps the cork in place. That woke me up, no mess though. Pours close to clear yellow with a large quickly diminishing white head. Fresh, juicy fruity smell, a bit like sour candy. Aroma is fresh apples, grapes, light barnyard, oak, musty. Taste is light/medium sweet and light sour. Light body, oily texture, lively carbonation. Refreshing and drinkable, perhaps not as complex as the best in the style but still very enjoyable.


Had it again and enjoyed it a lot, so up. Juicy, balanced and refreshing.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2016 Bottle sampled at WtWBA Brooklyn 2013.  Pours a golden orange body with short white head & lacing throughout. Aroma is lemon zest, funk and grape. Mouthfeel is medium and dry with nice carbonation and notes of lemon funk, floral zest and oak. Very nice.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2014 Bottle @ Bierhuyske

I have no clue why this isnt superwanted stuff .. Its one of the best ones for me !

Bottle 75 cl, bottled in January 2009. Pours hazy golden in color with a massive foamy white head. Light funkiness, a bit of stable and old cottage wooden notes in aroma. Slightly sharp mouthfeel at first, sour grapefruit and a bit of lemon fruitiness in taste. A bit of chewy wheat as well. Feels a bit dry, but quite crisp at the same time. Gets a lot better after awhile. Actually this is quite nice, liking that funky, slightly sour and a bit fruityness this one has got in aftertaste.

750mL bottle at Euston tap, pours a cloudy darkish orange with a small white head. Aroma of barnyard funk, some tart apricoty fruits, and mild acidity. Flavour brings out loads of barnyard funk, some tart apricot and peach, low acidity and some oak barrel complexity. Very complex overall - very tart, fruity and funky, finishing on oaky notes.  Excellent gueuze.

2009 75cl bottle, 03/25/2013. Copper pour, large-bubbled medium head settles to inviting haze on the surface. Poured the standard yellow with a minimal frothy white head. Aroma of sour fruit and spice. Medium, lively mouthfeel, moderately carbonated. Flavour of tart fruityness. Nice if a bit unspectacular.

Carbonation was medium to heavy but worked well with the gueze. Slightly dry in the finish but mostly just puckery and watering. Ill have another.

750 ml bottle opened with deyholla in the streets. Cheers, dude! Pours a brownish amber hue, richly hazed with frothy whitish head atop, stays as a firm film, laces well. Aromas are richly sour, lactic lemon, a touch of bile, oak, yogurt. Some bready malts. Initial is richly sour, big lactic lemon, yogurt, grapefruit and orange appeal. Crab apple, lemons, and rich oak. Good house brett, oak, and mellow bready malts. Some straw, some grass, dryness. Big lactic sour presence. Middle is a touch sweeter but still richly sour, lemons and lactic acid. Big citrus, sourness, gentle oak makes its way through. Backend is tart, dry, and lactic. Some oak, firm tartness, gentle bready malts. Well blended if a bit intense Lactic element. Solid.

Bottle shared by Adam, thanks! Pours a hazy deep amber orange with a tan head that dissipates quickly to the edges. Aroma has a strong funk note with menthol and an underlying strong sour backbone. Flavor has funk and sourness throughout with a strong menthol finish.

Bottle from Etre Gourmet. Pours hazy golden with a huge frothy white head. Lovely aroma, light sourish, horseblanket and vinegar. Taste is crisp and juicy, wood and light vinegar, but most of all freshness and moreish dryness. High carbonated, very good and recommendable ++

Bottle at Chez Moeder Lambic (Brussels, Belgium)
Aroma: Hay, barnyard aromas, citrus, slightly spicy.
Appearance: A very light amber color with a thin white head.

Palate: Thin textured and an average carbonation.
Havent ever seen this one outside of Belgium, so I tried it when I had the chance. And Im glad I did, because this is one of the better geuze blends that Ive had.

Bottle. Light hazy orange liquid with small to medium white head. Aroma of lemons, earthy funk, leather, wheat, barnyard, red berries and apple skin. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of lemons, barnyard and apple skin. Medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Very nice balance between sour fruit and funk.
Bottle. 2009 vintage.  Pours clear amber witb a white head.  Nose is funky cheese, dirty socks and fermented fruit. Taste is of sour apples. Mouthfeel is sour and  tingly. Good sour.

Bottle from 2009, from Barley Wine Copenhagen. Lots of bubbles and a big head, cloudy orange liquid. Funky but modest nose with tart apples and wet horse blanket. Dry and tart but little acid and oxidation makes it really drinkable. Fruity and funky. A bit meak and mild but relly tasty geuze that paired well with a goat cheese dish. Great!

Bottle 2009 vintage. Yellow hazy, huge head. Nose has pretty neutral nay, citrus, wheat, somewhat of a floral funk. More towards the yellow/lighter fruits. Body is medium/light. Sour, refreshing. Sour citrus, wheat. Ok, but not the best of the style. Feels a bit too light and plain, doesnt have the slightly woody, darker horseblanket Im looking for in these.

0.37l corked bottle. This is a kinda cloudy orange-golden one with an over-massive white top that fades quicker than Schumacher in his best days, only leaving a thin islandy and sidesticking little thing. The nose is tart with apples, brett, wood, a surprising sweet caramel-like thing and tones of spiderweb, dust and construction place. Fresh! It has a lively, no make that aggressive carbonation level this! The taste is fruity with tart apples, wood, raspberries, wet forest, bitter used dishwash water, rose leafs, soap and stingy not right red berries. Lots of things going on here indeed, but its not before I pair it with cheese that the flavors really impresses me. Its perhaps a bit to pungent and soapy to be fantastic, but its definitely not bad either, and with cheese? Great! 09.11.2012
nice geuze especially after a few years my recommendation is at least 4 years of cellaring! but man if youre thirsty go for it ;)

I had heard reports of potato notes as well as red peppers but I tasted none of that. This was a 375ml of the 2009 vintage. Overall this was a great gueuze. Its really a shame that we cant buy this in the U.S. because Id drop some cash on it. As it is I really cant because shipping from Belgium is just too much. This reminded me more of a 3F than say Cantillon.

375ml corked and caged bottle from Jan 2009.

Okay, I put it in the fridge for about an hour and when I removed the cage, the cork shot out like a rocket. Thankfully, I didnt lose much of the beer.

It pours a huge head of foam..I can see a cloudy straw yellow brew underneath. As the foam shrinks, it leaves some nice lacing behind.

The smell is both very sour and a bit bitter. Lots of apple like tartness dominate but theres also a barnyard kind of smell there. It smells so good. I wonder if the taste can match it.

Green apple tartness is up front, slight hint of funk, a bit of hop bitterness, more sourness...this is a grand brew to drink if you really dig sours. Im smacking my mouth drinking this. I just dont want the sourness of this brew to leave my palate!

On the low end of medium bodied with a lively level of carbonation, the mouthfeel is just fine.

This IS one hell of a Geuze! De Cam beers are awesome!

This is still something Id reach to very frequently, when in the mood for gueze, but the stark contrast between acidic/dry is something I need to get used to.

text: Clear straw pour with a medium sized white head. Huge lemon tarntness and barnyard funk in the nose, leading to sharp sourness, bubblegum, woody earth, and leather in the flavor. From notes.  First reviewed 10/3/2011.  Poured from a 350 mL bottle into a tulip. Thanks to goodstrongbeer for bringing this over.

The pour is a hazy tangerine color, slightly muted color with a gentle off-white head. 

Full and sour, the aroma is pretty awesome. There is some funk and a nice level of grapefruit and lemon zest sour aromas. 

Although it is easiest to note the full sour flavor, there is a lot of complexity here as well. Soft grains start off each sip, followed by lemon zest and grapefruit citrus sour. Light oak and some musty notes come in toward the end. 

The carbonation is on the light side here. The sour flavor and acidity is most noticeable. The body shades to the light side of medium.

This is just a great example of a sour gueuze. Very enjoyable.

(bottle) pours a bright orange colour with a frothy white head. complex aroma of herbal hops, lemons and vanilla, white pepper, cardamom, treebark, bubble gum and light smoke, also slightly composty in a good way. flavour is mostly lemons, yeasty and mellow, with a medium sourness, a hint of mushrooms and a minerally finish. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.

375 ml bottle bought @ Etre Gourmet. Pours hazy orange-ish yellow with a big white head that leaves some trace on the glass while slowly dissipating. 2003 bottle from mixmasterob...thanks Robert! - Pours clear light amber with a ring of white head. Nice funky cheese note with lots of citrus rind and a nice acidic tinge. Beautiful tart taste--a ton of acidic funk with some light cheese and a lemony juice note. Very refreshing and tart. Yum.

January 09 bottle from James - thanks!  Pours a murky golden yellow with a frothy white head.  Aroma is pungent cheese rind funk, oak, soft lemon, and a bit of tart in the background.  Smells good.  Taste has an odd off-tart ring up front followed by some dry cheese rind, an odd, corse flavor like singed grain with a sour tinge, medium tart, and light lemon.  Mouthfeel is a bit flabby for the style and ends on an almost watery note.  Bit disjointed with the sour tinge dominating to the detriment of the beer.  As much as I love the lambic gueuze style I did not particularly care for this beer that much.

Pours a yellow-gold with a spritzy white head that fades quickly but good lacing. Head comes back with a gentle swirl. The nose is absolutely mesmerizing. Oak, fresh lemons, wet dog, mandarin oranges. Really complex. Really funky. Taste is acidic but balanced. I like gueuze to be dry and acidic, and this one is certainly that, but maintains balance throughout and never becomes one-dimensional. The finish is bone-dry and very tart. Very clean. A touch of bitterness at the very end. Mouthfeel is spot-on. Crisp and lively and light. If I could I would drink these all the time. I was very happy to have found this so easily in Brussels, not only in bars but bottle shops too. While Id place it just below Girardin, this is a heck of a beer and a worthy bag-weight on international flights.

Bottle @ home, courtesy of arminjewell. Thanks a bunch! Saved me $35! Cloudy, golden orange appearance with a cream colored head. Lots of funk, Parmesan cheese, lemon citrusy, fairly tart aroma. Moderately sour with a slight burn on the finish but the beer is marked by the very funky, lemon citrusy flavor with notes of cheese, barnyard, cobwebs, and lemon zest.

Pour out of 375 mL bottle from 2009, slightly hazy orange with nice white head. Carbed pretty highly but works well, a very nicely made geuze just needs a bit more tartness to it.

Bottle. Slightly hazy golden with small off-white head. Flavour is malt, sour, tart, little barnyard and a little citrus.

Pours clear golden with a small dense white head.  The aroma has a clean crisp citrus acidity and lactic acid along with lighter notes of vinegar and blue cheese.  The body is thin and sharp with some light flowing prickly carbonation.  The taste starts off with the acidic traits, but there is actually a malt presence that really makes things smoothed out and gives it an overall refreshing quality.  There are also hints of peaches and a bit of a spicy kick.  The finish a little more of the blue cheese taste and leaves a long lasting sourness/tartness that is well balanced with the malt and not overwhelming of the palate at all.  This is a great beer.  I was told that this bottle was around 10 years old & have to say that it sure has aged gracefully.

Dark yellow and hazy. Has a white head, medium duration. Acidic aroma, some soft sweetness too, basic sugars too. But mostly acidic. Flavor starts acidic and sweet, complex. Dry texture. Soft carbonation.

Pours almost still with a slightly hazy golden color with burnt orange hues when held to a light and very faint bubbles that quickly disappears leaving no lace.

Incredibly funky, earthy aroma with a very prominent barnyard/horsey presence. Hints of cobweb, oak, vegetable, horseblanket and band aid with crisp light fruit and vinegar. Hints of apple and pear that along with the vinegar provides some nice sweetness in the nose that balances out all of the funk.

Tart puckering medium body with lots of sour barnyard funk without beng acetc or acdic at all. Intensely puckering but clean with lots of earthy funk and sourness without being harsh or abrasive. Slight light fruit presence with hints of apple and pear and a nice vinegar/vinaigrette flavor at the end of the swallow that leaves me drooling for more. I cant believe that this beer can be so complex, funky and drinkable all at the same time. Some sours/lambics/gueuze can become a bit much after a while but I could drink this beer all night. Amazing!

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2013 375 ml Bottle. Slightly hazy gold pour with a nice white head. Aroma is very unique, never smelled a gueuze quite like this. Taste is sour, but not very much so, far less than cantillon or 3 fonteinen. Light peppery flavor is also present, with a lot of grain and a touch of that classic gueuze funk. A: Pale golden-wheat body. Two finger sized head formed as it was poured into a tumbler. Just the slightest cloudiness. Soapy lacing.
S: Bright lemons, white grapes, oak and miscellaneous soft citric fruits.

O: A sure-fire stand out that makes a good argument for being among the best "standard" geuzes.

aroma of barn, apples, vinegar, cherries and stuff youve had in your cellar for a while. taste has lots of sour (unripe) apples, lemon juice, barn and some sour berries: red currants etc. deliciously dry on the palate.
Pretty classic gueuze aroma; funky brett, lemons, and light vanilla.  Slightly off dry flavor with a wee bit of bitterness on the finish and a subtle vanilla aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours with a thin bubbly white head that goes really quickly, mostly clear sunflower orange color.  Leather dominates the aroma, with light funk and white grapeskins.  Flavor follow suit, with leathery and earthy tones, some light fruits, and a nice funky acidity.  Lightish body with bubbles, and fucking great dry finish.  Love this speed, and they have nailed the style.  Good stuff.

750ml Bottle (2006 Vintage, Bottle 1/06):  Aroma of funk, lambic, very tart fruit, spicy (like pepper), wood, spiced wood, and general awesomeness.  Poured orange/amber/gold in color with a tiny white head around the edges only.  Not sparkling.  Hazy.  Flavor is heavily tart, medium spicy, and heavily sweet.  Tastes of lambic, tart fruit, wood, and acid.  Medium body.  Lightly dry, mouth-puckering-tart, texture.  Average to lively carbonation.  Tart fruit and wood finish is spicy, heavily tart, and heavily sweet.  Delicious.

Bottle @ Pikkulintu. Poured hazy yellowish orange with a small, almost white head. Sharp acidic aroma with hints of apple, newly cut grass and barn yard. Sour flavour with fruity and floral notes as well as earthy impressions. A nice gueuze to dissolve your enamel into.

375ml bottle dated January 2009. Pours exactly the way I wanted - a decent amount of head and an amber body. Aroma is deep sour wood notes, fermented hay, lemon. Taste is light, very sour, lots of lemon and a very dry finish. A very good gueuze.

Bottle. Dark amber colour with a small white-ish head. Aroma of barnyard, fruit, sourness, sour grapes/apples/berries. Also some brett and citrus. Taste is highly sour with lots of citrus and dark but sour berries. Some barnyard and yeast as well. Fairly big body, medium duration, medium-big body.

Aroma has lots of oak, grapes, tart grapes, white wine, nice fresh aroma. Taste is nice and tart, oak, grapes, white wine, brett, barn yard, sour apples, some malt and yeast sweetness. Just beautiful taste.

(750 ml bottle @ Olutravintola Pikkulintu. Rated @ 7.3.2010.)
Hazy orange colour with a small head. Fresh and acidic aroma with notes of wood, grapefruit and spices. Nicely sour taste with floral notes. Extremely dry on the palate with a dry finish. Awesome gueuze.
Sparkling, clear, pale body and  small head with white foam. Aroma of  oak, apples, basement aromas, earthy. The taste is light sweet and heavy long lasting sour finish - but very good! Dry.

2007 750mL

Lightly hazed copper with off white head, good retention, minimal lacing. A little darker than most, but a sexy gueuze indeed. Lemon rinds, acetic acid, horse blanket, and oak. Taste is more of the smell, very well balanced. A nice sweetness to balance the acetic and citric acids.

Its been almost a year since I had this last, but its still my favorite of all the gueuze blenders.

Serving type: bottle

750 mL bottle at Moeder Lambic Fontainas in Brussels. Shared with my girlfriend, who now loves sours and lambics. Clear, dark gold pour with a vivacious white, bubbly head. Aroma holds lemon, herbs, wood, and a light Bretty funk. Flavor is much more aggressively sour, with white grapefruit, barnyard, and hay- classic geuze. Mouthfeel is balanced and has a surprisingly drinkable finish; still dry, but not too rude. Very nice lambic.

375cl bottle at home Vintage 2009. This is a top quality beer and one that I must get more of. The aroma is brett, funk, lemon and limes. The flavour is very well balanced with all of the traditional geuze characteristics on show. This is potentially my favorite currently made oude geuze. Fantastic beer that I will have to lay down in the cellar.

Fløska. Tökk til pinnurbólturin vinurin. Unclear deep golden colour. Lovely tart fruity lightly mouldy aroma. Good mouthfeel. Quite tart pleasant fruity caramel flavour, dry tart finish. Great funky brew.

{thoughts} Complex, balanced and harmonious; dry, vinous and roundly acidic; no characteristic overwhelms or outshines the others.

{elements} Pale copper hue, lightly hazy, no sustained head. Broad --sometimes pungent-- aroma of wet hay, alfalfa, light barnyard, apples and juniper berries. The flavor is oily in that it saturates the palate in a most intense fashion; gin-like, with notes of almonds / cherry pits and walnuts. Dry, heavily acidic (though gently rounded), lightly bitter if that. Medium-light body, oily texture, lethargic carbonation. 37.5 cl bottle @ GP Tuulensuu, bottled on April 2007.
Bottle.Clear orange colour with white head.Aroma of sour champagne and acid good balance between the sournish and hops gives this beer a not to bitter taste and makes easy to drink.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2011 Bottle.
clear yellow, smooth light yellow head
aroma is sour, leather. supernice, well balanced
flavor is citrussy, leathe,r super balance, dry. tart. reminds me of girarding  black label.

head: none 
colour: dark blond 
smell: sour, champagne like yeasty , hops , malts 
taste: sour malty start , citric, orange , peel , nuts, dry finish , NICE !
Sample, part of the "Pruufpalet". Cloudy golden color with few to none head. Aroma of sour citrus. Taste is sour, citrus, orange peel and a good bite. Good geuze.

Bottle. Pours an unclear, dark amber beer with a white head. The aroma is tart and acidity. The flavor is tart, acidity and sour apples. The palate is fresh and wellcarbonated. Overall a good beer with a good balance.

375ml bottle thanks to ericandersnavy.  Poured a hazy light amber body with fizzy carbonation.  Aroma of sweet and sour, brett, funk, lemony and a hint of white wine sourness.  Flavor was sour, tart, funky and brett.  Thin body with active carbonation.  Nice dry finish.  Good, but a bit too sour for me.

Shared with g-dog on VM 2010 opening day. Bubbling yellow look with a thich white head leaving lacings. Sharp powerfull wild fermented nose, bringing the mouth water forth. Sour vinegar flavor with a little citrus and a great great tart finish. Great geuze
Tasted 2010-06-12. Bottle from 2009. Pours clear, orange with big white head. Bretty nose. Slightly hoppy. Very acidic on the palate. Citric. Fruity. Delicious.
Bottle. Cloudy copper body with a small white head. Aroma is lemon candy, acid, hay. Flavor is lemon acid, earth. Nice and very drinkable.

Big bottle 75 cl. from Dranken geers in Belgium. Shared with Signe, who is a sucker for these sour bastards store in the cellar. The cork goes of with a flump, quite highly carbonated. The pour is clear ligh brownish yellow with an impressive white foamy head that takes over half the glass. The nose has that special sourness that are both a bit acidic and a little lactic. Some sour yellow winegums and canned corn with the juice from green grapefruits. The taste is pretty straight forward gueuce-wise. It is sour without any artificial sweeteners off cause. Its sour all the way but with a finish that tends to sweeten the experience a bit. The palate is medium but on the light side. Super gueuze. Sad to have opened it on a rainy evening. This would be perfect on a warm evening served chilled.

375ml bottle shared by alfrantzell on BA.

Brilliant clear golden pour with a small white head.

Smell is not great.  I get some rotten eggs and sulfur along with the sweet malt and barnyard funk.

Sweet and tart malt flavor with a great barnyard funk profile.  Some sour unripe stone fruit notes in there as well.

Once again, De Cam nails the mouthfeel.  Great acidity with medium body and lively carbonation.  Really sticks with you.

This is a very drinkable gueuze and an enjoyable beer overall.  Im excited to have ticked - I mean tried - the big 3 from De Cam.

2006 bottle at Kulminator. Very apple juice like appearance with no head. Aromas of apple peel are there as well. Tart, complex, vinous, lactic and sour. Nice acidity and a faint sweetness. Almost flat, carbonation is a just a light tingle on the tongue.

Part of a blind gueuze tasting hosted by ryan.  One of the higher rated gueuzes for me.  Overall a very strong beer thats good lots of sourness, though not overpowering.  Lots of funk.  Orange brown pour with a slight yellow tint.  Good amount of fluffy white head.  lots of funky sourness on the nose.  Some earth and wood and a touch of citrusy lemon.  Earthy and musty; everyhting youd expect from a lambic.  Good flavor.  Sourness is strong but not overpowering.  Funky and earthy.  Noticeable oak on the finish.

Bottled 375ml. Vintage 2006. Vanilla, oak, white grapes, raisin and Rodenbach-like tanins throughout. Acetic. Faint malt sneaking in. Surprisingly sweet finish. A very good beer, but certainly not my favorite type of gueuze.
citrus, golden, cloudy, sparkling, tan foam, medium sourness, salty, medium body, lively, bitter, long finish,

Bottle from Beermerchants.com. Golden orange pour with a white lasting head. Tart aromas of lemon, pineapple, grapefruit, lime. It has a subtle sweetness in the nose too. Lactic, lemon, orange peel, grapefruit tang tastiness. Excellent sour flavours. Dry, sour, woody finish. Top quality geuze.
Bottle at home. Pours a clear orange with a small head. Tart with some berry aromas. Also aromas of unripe grapes. Hints of vinegar. Medium to full bodied. Medium to high carbonation. Sour finish.

Tart and sweet aroma with a bit of skunkiness and another smell that I cant quite put my finger on. Cloudy appearance - tannish yellow and an almost non-existant head. Tastes like a cross between pickle juice and a super tart dry white wine. Definitely an acquired taste.
Pours cloudy amber with a white head. Aroma is malt, lactic acid, barnyard,apple, fresh and crisp. Flavour is malt, very acidic, apple, crisp. Dry aftertaste.

(37.5cl bottle 2006 vintage thanks to ericandersnavy) opaque yellow with constant film of bubbles on top. Nose of salt, toast, funk, vinegar, currants, apricot and tart cherries. Complex and delicious. Taste is extremely tart, vinegar, cranberry, white grapes, oak, wet barrel, and sour cherries. This has absolutely spot on carbonation with a medium body and dry finish. The duration is long and tart. Excellent!
Cloudy orange, nice white head. Smells of lemon and cold steel. Very lemony flavor, with notes of vinegar and dust. dry finish. Very tasty.
Taste thanks to ericandersnavy.  Sour - good stuff.  Lots of citrus and lime in the flavor.  A slight skunkiness in the nose (green glass?) but not off putting.
bottle thanks to bierkonig. poured yellow with a white head. aroma was awesome with lemon, funk, tart, and some other great things. flavor was as equally impressive.  great beer!

This beer is pretty awesome. My night cap choice. Thanks to Ang for the recommendation and to Beermerchants!  Dry-sour mouth feel; can note sharp lemon, light fruits and a touch of citrus. Finish is long, dry, sharp and fruity. The beer is awesome. The body is good and the balance is awesome. I am seriously enjoying this beer.. Poured into Beermerchants glass at home from a 37.5cl bottle. Dated January 2009. Thanks guys, getting this in the UK is awesome. Im going to lie down and wait for excitement.
vintage del 2006 37.5 cl geuze molto buono..citrico agrumato morbido quasi punta di salato eheheh....

Bottle. 2009 vintage. 

Hazy golden orange with a relatively big white head that shows good retention.

The aroma is very funky. Almost no acidic notes come through at all, everything is just horse blanket, mud, cheese etc. 

The flavor is tart and very bretty. The same onslaught of horse blanket and mud coupled with some more spicy brett notes. Some hints of tart berries, lemon and grass. The finish has some grassy bitterness to it, a hint of minerals and tart funkiness.  

Medium body and not as dry as many gueuzes. Lots of carbonation.

A good one. Brett-forward rather than sour. I wonder how this one would be with a couple of more years on it.

hazy dark orange with a small off-white head. Aroma is utterly funky and barnyardy, almost shitty, cheesy. Really the definition of "funk". Flavour is about the same, funky brett, cheese, hai, barnyard. Very funky with low acidity which I do think the beer suffer from quite a bit. All this funk really need some acidity to cut through and make it more refreshing. Nice brew however with a nice sparkling, lively palate.

375mL bottle. Pours translucent yellow amber, topped with a medium sized ivory head. Beautiful, sharp lactic aroma, with notes of orange rind, green apple, mold, barnyard, and perhaps a little menthol. Lactate is not as intense in the flavor as in the aroma. Lemon, green apple and grain add complexity to the palate. Thin to medium bodied, with medium carbonation. Mellow and very drinkable.

Clear golden-yellow, long lasting large white head, excellent lacing.
Aroma is very acidic, woody, funky, lots of horse blanket, cheese, earth.
Flavour is highly sour, acidic, lots of lemon citrus, vinegar, white grapes, apples.
Highly sour mouthfeel, medium/light body, high carbonation.
Finishes very long, acidic, citrus. 
Umm, wow. Aging very nicely. Incredibly flavourful, high complex. 
375ml bottle purchased at Utobeer in London, England, May 2005.
Opened on February 28, 2009.
Bottled March 15, 2003. Best before March 3, 2023.

Bottle. Amber beer with an off-white head. Sour, lemon/green apple aroma with dust and earth. Sour, lemon/green apple flavor with earth and oak. Medium bodied. Sourness lingers with earth and dust, green apple and lemon. Nice complexity.

Bottle (2004):  The aroma consists of lemony sourness with a hint of peach and sweat.  It pours a hazy, bordering on cloudy, golden-orange with a small white head.  The flavor consists of a mild lemony sourness, a hint of citrus, and a hint of oakiness in the finish.  Medium bodied with a creamy mouthfeel.  I could drink a ton of this.

Where the Wild Beers Are @ The Gate 8/30/09.  2003.  Golden orange flat.  Barnyard horseballs leather lemon aroma.  Barnyard horseballs melon grapfruit with dry finish.  Would be awesome with carbonation.
Bottle from 2005 at the Where the Wild Beers are event. Clear gold, still no head.  Little vinegar.  Sour, clean and light malt. A bit acidic.  Flat.  Lightly acidic finish.

Tart crab apple on the nose, sour strawberry great funk and horsey aroma.  Pours clear golden with a little carbonation.  Tart apple skins, thin mouthfeel, there is a malty sweetness, dry, horsey and funky.  Excellent gueuze!!

Bottle 2002, courtesy of Jakob.  
Pours an hazy yellow with a long lasting white head. 
In the nose its smooth, dry and dusty citrus with a nice hint of stable and goat - slightly perfumed. 
The flavour is incredible smooth with notes of ripe dry grape and wood. 
It has a great long and soft, dry grape after taste with a earthy touch.
Absolutely astonishing and without doubt the best beer I ever had! 
 
Re-rate with courtesy of plovmand. 
Surprisingly not as smooth and delicious as the first one I had. This one was much more acidic and lagged the ripe grape, goat and perfume.
8-4-7-4-15=3,8
Bottle. Hazy golden body and a medium white head. Grape fruit, acid and slight mint in nose. Flavour is Sour grapes, acid and wood. Dry texture.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2011 375ml bottle from ygtbsm.  thanks brad....pours a golden apple cider brown with a thin wispy head at first that quickly dissipates.... tart and funky aroma with an assertive lemony cheese accents... flavors are acidic and tart, mild funky.  medium carbonation but just faintly thin overall.  could have used more liveliness.  quite refreshing and quaffable.
De cam geueze. 375ml bottle thanks to toke @ olbutikken. Thanks to our  
new friend!... Pours a crystal clear tangerine orange with a thin,  
somewhat fizzy, and topped with an effervescent white head... Aroma is  
dominant on green pepper, white pepper, before moving into a sfter  
geueze like quality. Very subtle metallic in the backend... Flavors  
still have a bit of a green pepper feel to it, very mildly sour and  
softer suprisingly. Softer finish a fair bit pale. Carbonation is  
somewhat sprite and short-lived.
7/4/7/3/14
Scoring for this brew is from my intiial rating although the bottle had at olbutikken had an overwhelming green pepper feel to it which i didnt care much for.
One year old bottle.  Darker than most, 3 bubbles only.  Very feint yeasty aroma.  Full mouth, sour and dry.  Nice dry finish.  Definitely improves with age.

Golden with a lasting white head. Complex funky aroma, with grapefruit, wood, cellar and a touch of medicine. Medium acidity, some wood and grapefruit in the flavour. Easy drinking and smooth, very pleasant geuze!

Golden with a nice egg white head. Aromas of honey, balsamic vinegar, musty cellar, spicy pepper and wet wood. Flavour is acidic, crisp and dry with notes of spice, wood and fruit. Very complex and well matured. Great sample!

2003 bottle @ Bier Circus.  Pours somewhat hazy orange-amber with off-white head.  Aroma of lemons, funk, and pepper.  Taste is aceto and lemons all the way.  Some minerality in there as well.  Warming acidity and drying in the finish.  Damn I love De Cam.
Bottle thanks to bhops. Orange in color with little to no head. Aroma is sour and fruity. Taste is sour and woody.

Bottle thanks to bhops.  The smell is tarty, horsey, barnyard, hay, and blanket.  The look is orange in color, has a white head, and clearish.  The taste is tart, fruits, complex, funk, acidic, and sour.

Courtesy of Bhops. Hazy golden with a white head. Awesome funky barrel barnyard piss, cheesy aromas. Light sprizty mouthfeel. Classic dry gueze flavors of lemon, wood, hay and earthy barnyard. Mighty fine fucking beer here.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Bottle thanks to bhops. Hazy gold body with little head. Aroma of cheese and sourness. Flavor was primarily citrus sour.
bottle,thanks to bhops, cloudy yellow color with slight foam, nose is white pepper, very sour , flinty chalkboard flavors, great dry finish
Bottle thanks to bhops. Pours with a hazed yellow body with a sparing head. Aroma of horse blanket, citrus-sour, wood and funk. Taste is citrus and funk with a noticeable sourness. Light carbonation.
Poured golden yellow, CO2, tart, funk,  citrus, acidic, other fruits, little bready, sour dry finish.

Pours a bright golden with a decent off white head. The nose is full and tart, with a bit to much phenolic influence, otherwise it would be an 8. The flavor is dry and tart with grapefruit citrus and a bit of phenolic influence there as well.
Wonderful and well balanced gueze. The taste is, of course, very acidic, but not as harsh as for instance Hanssens. This beer is just classy.

Thanks to Chuck for sharing.  375 ml bottles.  Pours moslty clear deep gold nice carbonation and a foamy largish head.  Aroma of funked out wood, goaty, horse blanket, easth and dirst , horsee manure, slight grapefruit and tropical fruits.  Good funky and sour flavor- lactic acid, harsh astringent woodiness, more earth, slight apple, pineapple, butyric sweaty animal and a bit cheesy isovaleric - awesome tart and sour finsih.  Great Gueze!
oro poca schiuma poco persistente note acide legno fruttato leggero un po ossidata buona peristenza medio agressività

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2011 Courtesy of YGTBSM94.  Bottled 3/15/03, drank fall 08. Clear pale body with a tiny white head. The nose is cheese, hay, a touch of band aid, yogurt and light lemon. The flavor is grapefruit, yogurt, blue cheese, lemon and dough. Medium body is very soft with light carbonation.  Just an update on the 03 bottle, as of Jan 11, the nose is still amazing and bright on this. The taste is starting to oxidize a bit and fade. Finishes with a bitter citrus peel.

Thanks to OldStyleCubFan for shairng. 06 bottle. The pour is a hazy bright gold with a thin fizzy white head. Still. The nose is tart, citrusy, lemongrass, dry, oaky, acidic, yeasty. The flavor is mildly tart, sour and acidic, lemongrass, barnyard flavors. The palate is a tad thin and acidic.

Bottle shared at the Carolina Crew tasting by OldStyleCubFan - thanks, Todd! Pours a darker orange than I expected, with faint champagne-like carbonation. Rich and tart nose. Taste is not super complex or acidic, and the finish is a touch thin. But it’s certainly a very high quality example of the style.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2012 06 bottle generously shared by Todd. Funky sour nose. Lemony and earthy.  Golden orange pour with small ring of head.  Thin finish, but otherwise a very tasty gueuze. 

Rerate: 2009 bottle thanks to CanIHave4Beers. Pours hazy orange-tinted golden with a thin white head. Nose of sour apple, barnyard, pear, and mild pineapple. Smells sweeter than most, and taste has some sweetness, but still nicely tart. Freaking great.

Thanks to Todd for sharing this.  Vintage 2006.  Hazy gold pour with minimal head. Seemed almost flat.  Very lively on the tongue.  Big acidic aroma.  Complex flavor.  Apples, pears, leather, and must.  Fine example of the style.
37,5 cl bottle at Delirium Cafe. Pours hazy golden with a small white head. Wonderful aroma. Earthy, horseblanket, woody, vague vinegar, vinous, crisp, sour and dry. Amazing.

Jan. 2006 bottle, thanks to my buddy who brought it back from Brugges.  No head at all and very flat looking.  However, the mouthfeel was sufficiently carbonated.  The smell is how I would imagine my socks would smell after a day of picking apples in an orchard.  Lots of sour apple flavor.  Great sourness, almost like a sour apple Jolly Rancher.  Great sour beer, even if it looks flat.

(Bottle, Akkurat, Stockholm, 17 Nov 2008) Golden amber colour, slightly hazy. Almost no carbonation and no head. Tart nose with grapefruit, green apples, stable and barnyard. Acidic, tart taste with notes of lemon, grapefruit, green apples, red-currant and unripe gooseberries. Fresh and juicy acidity rather than sour and musty. Medium body. The low carbonation makes it quite flat, but that feels kind of right. Very nice beer. In short: fresh and tart grapefruit in a horse stable.

Big thanks to GodOfThunder.  January 2006 bottling, aged nearly 3 years.  The pour yields a hazy, yellowish-golden colored body.  There is virtually zero head or lace, the only sign of carbonation being a smattering of bubbles at the bottom of the glass and a hazy film at the surface.  The aroma hits like a funk bomb, musty notes of horseblanket, dust, and earth mingling wonderfully with soured apricot and acidic lemon.  Flavors follow suit, the powerful sourness of the fruit and the dry, dusty, farmhouse elements working hand in hand.  Very lightly carbonated on the tongue, almost flat in fact, the mouthfeel is dry, puckering, and refreshing.  This is another mighty fine lambic from De Cam.

Courtesy GodofThunder.  Cloudy straw-light orange in color, very little head.  Very strong musky acetic aroma, background barnyard notes.  Low carbonation on the palate, the sharp acetic aggressiveness of the aroma is toned down, the taste is more balanced with the earthier notes.  Tamer than the other De Cam sours I’ve had, but certainly not lacking in overall quality.

375ml corked bottle lugged back from Belgium, originally purchased in the Oud Arsenaal Beer Shop in Antwerp.  Bottled in September 2004, drank in October 2008.  A treat to say the least.  The smell of the cork alone in lemony, flowery, and full of wheaty citrus wild yeast awesomeness.  After a few years in the bottle it sure holds up nice, no off aromas or lack of carbonation.  Sour, vinegary, and full of wheat dryness, especially in the finish.  The mouthfeel is perfect, tingly carbonation but not as overboard harshly bitter as some other classic Gueuzes.  Top notch authentic stuff,  worth it.

(Bottle, 0.75 l, at Pikkulintu, Helsinki, on 2008-10-17) Golden. Hazy. Medium sized white quite long lasting head. Sour and fruity nose. Full bodied and quite dry palate. Wood, sourness, malts, bitterness and some fruitiness in taste. Woody and bitter aftertaste. Very good gueuze.

Just a beautiful geuze. Golden in color with moderate carbonation. Aroma is sour as a geuze should be. What really stands out is the balance of this one--the funk, sour, fruit and tart that are staples of a geuze blend to create a most harmonious experience. Doesn’t have the lingering strange aftertaste of some lesser geuzes. Outstanding.
Thanks Brad for sending this my way.  Pours an unassuming orange hazy beer with a white head.  Gueuzey sour funk, light vinegar, tart and funk’d.  Dry with lemon acidity.   Awesome.

Bottle shared at a tasting courtesy of dewbrewer.  Thanks!
Pours a hazy thick yellowish pour with light white head.  Smell is sour, funky and grapefruity.  Some cheesiness.  Taste is tart dull flavored sourness and funk.  Decent

Bottle thanks to miketd, you are the man Mike.  Poured a clear golden color with a thin white head that receded to a ring.  Aroma of tart, funky barnyard with healthy doses of straw, horse blanket, and some light fruit including citrus and soft berries.  Semi-sweet, tart entry with some funky barnyard yeast and some dry straw and horse blanket lead into a light citrus fruitiness dominated by sour lemon.  Low carbonation, smooth on the palate with a nice dry bite.  Awesome, thanks again Mike.
Many thanks to JK for sharing.  A solid geuze with plenty of the usual suspects - animal sweat, yeast, tartness, funk.  Delicious.  A similar taste with a decent sourness.
38cl, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex, balanced, hazy, small head, good sour geuze

Bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a longlasting creamy white head. Tart fruity citrus aroma with barnyard hints. Tart sour fruity citrus flavor. Has a rourish tart fruity finish with hints of citrus.

Carried home on my back from Belgium, March 2007, found in Baccus Cornelius, Brugge. Cloudy yellow and tall, thick white head.  Aroma is standard lambic with yeast and horse blanket. Some citrus fruit, lemon, yeast, and a little vinegar.  Sour and appropriate to style, but not as sour as a Cantillon or 3 Fontienen.  Maybe a little thin on the palate, but full flavored.
Thanks to JK.  Yellow pour with a creamy white head.  Tartness on the nose with barnyard funk.  Tart citrus notes with the funk carrying over nicely in the flavor.
Thanks to JK!  Hazy gold color with a large head.  Strong sour aroma.  Some lemon and musty barn air as well.  Plenty of sour wheat taste.  Very dry finish.  Solid.

Aroma of cork and light malt. Cloudy hazy yellow pour. Very sour drink very dryish and refreshing. Solid carbonation and medium bodied. Very solid beer that seems to clean your mouth out as you drink and as you might imagine a nice clean finish.

Appearance: Pours a clear, orange-golden body marked by a few stray bubbles.

Smell: Tart-smelling aroma of white wine, bales of hay, pear preserves, and dust-covered cobwebs.

Taste: Damp hay, a particularly tart chardonnay, and a restrained funkiness - all with a fist-clenching acidity. Hints of lemon wedges and sliced pears. Pleasing mustiness throughout. Lightly sour finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-thin body. Mild carbonation.

Drinkability: Some may consider it somewhat tame, but its still a very tasty, very satisfying brew.

courtesy of Toni Flükiger - hazy orange colour with a little foam; aroma of rhubarb, old apples and cellar with solid notes of vinegar, medium-bodied; the palate is initially smooth before a fair sourness; low carbonation and a dry sourish aftertaste of rhubarb and vinegar

Bottle, bought @ Den Tatoverede Enke, Cph.
Pours hazy yellowgolden with a fine, creamy white head. Good laicing and a fine duration. Aroma is citric tart, apples, light lime and oranges. Light carbonation, wonderful mouthfeel. Flavour is superbly tart, light lactic, but mostly citric. Good notes of oranges and overripe apple. Wonderful dryness with a light toffe touch at the far end. Great gueuze.

A cloudy yellow appearance with a minimal head. The aroma is lemons, oysters?, and vinegar. Lots of barnyard. NEEEIGH! The flavor is quite sour with some lemons, vinegar, and funky cheese. Harsh finish but in a good way. Excellent beer!!
Hey coloured. Some cloudiness. A nicely sour gueuze. A quite refreshing citrus taste.

DFW tasting 2008.  Thanks again to bu11zeye for sharing.  Pours a light golden yeloww with no head.  aroma is light vinegar and sour.  Flavor is the same.  This beer is very lively and well carbonated, it was great to drink and Id get another if I could!  Cheers!

A steady pour into my New Belgium globe glass produces a two finger thick, pale tan colored head. The beer is a honey amber color that shows a mostly clear, bright pale amber, gold tinged hue when held up to the light. The aroma is very vibrantly fruity and tart with an earthy undercurrent. Fresh pressed macintosh apples, table grapes, and some green, slightly tropical like fruit are backed by a softly smelling acidity, and a solid, musty, musky, rotting fruit like, saw-dust mushrooms, as well as some earthy, dried hay like, slightly toasted pale malt and grain notes. At times this smells a bit like sour apple jolly ranchers.

This has a prickly carbonation, a lightly biting tartness and an astringency to this up front, and is backed by a oxidation influenced malt character that is a touch nutty, definitely a bit like dried hay, or dried wildflowers, and perhaps a hint of sherry like notes. The body of this beer is fairly light, even for a Gueuze, I wouldnt call it watery though, as there is a touch of lactic slickness to this beer. The acidity here is dominantly lactic in character, this accentuates a grapefruit like flavor up front, but then accentuates a oxidation influenced cider like fruitiness towards the finish. Touches of toasted, nutty oak notes come out in the long finish where they linger lightly on the palate. This is light on funkiness, the Brettanomyces and more wild fermentation notes play a more subtle role in this Gueuze than I usually prefer; light mushroom notes, slightly musky, musty, with a soft phenolic influence.

Definitely not on the same level of the Tilquin or Girardin that I had the previous two nights; this lacks the richness, the deep complexity, and even the body of the previous two brews; to be honest I have not had a great vintage of this since I first sampled this from the source in 2001. The apparent oxidation is likely the major flaw to this brew, though even that is not unenjoyable. It is still not too shabby, and something I am quite happy to be quaffing, but I wont go out of my way to pick up more bottles of this vintage, but I am not ready to stop trying various vintages of this brew.
